intro: Fridericia mollis, commonly known as the silky fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens, though it is not widely cultivated.
